review_title: The best place to grow, have an impact, & feel like family
pros: Leadership is the greatest asset to IHA. The leadership team has fortitude and conviction; they are also caring and understanding. There is a special balance between business expectations & personal connection. Everyone at IHA fits the culture and friendships extend beyond the office doors. There is also growth potential; HR is proactive about professional development & providing the necessary tools to grow.
cons: IHA is rapidly growing; this 'start-up' nature comes with challenges. If you're willing to navigate process improvement & make a big impacts on the industry, there is nothing deterring about being part of IHA.

pros:
very high-value work for the industry
caring culture and environment
cons:
challenging workload at times
small team

job_title: Marketing Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: The people are great and the work is interesting.

review_title: Dynamic work, supportive team but difficult content
job_title: Director, Product Management in Oakland, CA
pros:
IHA has a really strong culture and great team spirit. People work hard but they also know when to unplug and enjoy each others' company. You get to have lots of autonomy in your work and there are many opportunities to collaborate cross-functionally. It's a small team of incredibly intelligent people working on very difficult industry-wide problems. Each day is satisfying in its own way.

Leadership has high expectations but they're understanding and supportive. 

Office is very conveniently located above the BART station and is close to the restaurant scene, and there's a culture of lunch outings.
cons: The work is complex and difficult. The content is complicated and information flows fast. The team is small so we rely on outsourcing a lot of our work and every aspect of the work comes with heavy vendor management. Work/life balance can suffer if you don't create boundaries early on. Each day is satisfying but you walk away with battle scars.

review_title: Wonderful work environment with great coworkers
pros: I've only been here a short time and I'm still getting used to the work/people/culture. So far it's been fantastic in terms of the working environment. I come from the high tech field, so in contrast I'd say IHA is a breath of fresh air. I feel like I have a real impact here, even as an individual contributor. I don't get the feeling that I'm just a cog in a wheel. I also feel that my voice is always heard, which wasn't the case in my past. So far it's been a very pleasant experience with the folks here. It's great not to have drama at my workplace.
cons: IHA has a very start-up vibe, which some may not find attractive. Don't expect to be hand held very much,  and there's a lot of self learning to be done. You're expected to be contributing to projects even though you're still onboarding.

job_title: Client Success Manager in Oakland, CA
pros: The company is small but mighty, pushing for various initiatives that improve the quality, cost and access to healthcare in CA. Company is flexible, provides a career succession plan and lots of opportunity for growth. IHA is big on culture and you can tell management really cares about its employees.
Smart and friendly people who care about each other, convenient office location (right next to BART), career development opportunities, and the chance to learn A LOT about the healthcare industry
cons: After a period of quick growth the company is still building important internal processes

pros: Friendly staff,  great location, unique work that generates positive impacts to the Healthcare industry and professional growth opportunities
cons: Workloads can be heavy at times and office space can be tight

review_title: Growing and friendly team at IHA!
pros: Healthy work culture, interesting projects, and great location!
cons: Dissemination of information within the company could be improved.
